title: The dynamics of AI capability and its influence on public value creation of AI within public administration
theoretical_background: Resource-Based Theory (RBV); Innovation capability theory; Technology-Organisation-Environment Framework (TOE)
research_description: This article investigates how AI capabilities affect public value creation within public administration, using case studies across 15 public administrations in Europe.
research_results: The study highlights the role of organisational AI capabilities, including tangible, intangible, and human resources, in driving the development and successful implementation of AI systems.
future_research: Future research could explore how organisational structures influence the long-term success of AI implementations and their contributions to public value creation.
